title: Crystal Cruises unveil new river cruise brand and private Boeing 787 Dreamliner trips
text:
Crystal Cruises unveil new river cruise brand and private Boeing 787 Dreamliner trips Crystal Cruises unveil new river cruise brand and private Boeing 787 Dreamliner trips Crystal Cruises has announced plans for three luxury expedition cruise ships, a new river cruise brand and around-the-world trips in its own Boeing 787 Dreamliner. PUBLISHED: 13:02, Mon, Jul 20, 2015 | UPDATED: 14:27, Mon, Jul 20, 2015 PH The Crystal Esprit will mark the debut of the new all-inclusive Crystal Yacht Cruises programme 
With its new 62-passenger Crystal Esprit due to join its two ships Crystal Symphony (922 passengers) and Crystal Serenity (1,070 passengers) this autumn, the cruise line has also ordered three new "Crystal Exclusive Class" expedition cruise ships. 
The polar ice class vessels will be built by Lloyd Werft in Germany and the first is expected in late 2018. 
From spring 2017 Crystal River Cruises will offer all-inclusive luxury cruises worldwide, and the same year it will launch Crystal Luxury Air, to take passengers on typically 28-day holidays visiting up to 12 remote or sought-after destinations, staying at some of the world's best hotels and resorts. 
The announcements have come exactly 25 years after Crystal Cruises launched its multi award-winning cruise brand. 
Its new parent company Genting Hong Kong's investment is aimed at creating "the world's premier luxury hospitality and lifestyle brand portfolio", according to Crystal's chairman Tan Sri Lim Kok. We are ecstatic to continue pioneering new areas of luxury travel Tan Sri Lim Kok, Crystal's chairman 
The cruise line's president and CEO, Edie Rodriguez, said: "We continue to think bigger, aiming to create unparalleled luxury experiences and adventures for our loyal and new guests, who - like Crystal - continue to seek broader horizons and new perspectives on the world. 
"We are ecstatic to continue pioneering new areas of luxury travel," she added. 
"Crystal's newly expanded fleet will truly be travellers' passport to virtually the entire world." 
Crystal Esprit will be delivered this November, with its December 23 maiden voyage around the Seychelles Islands followed by a New Year's Eve celebration at the Taj Dubai Hotel. Related articles Six of the best destinations on a cruise down the River Elbe 
The 62-passenger ship will be an all-suite yacht with a "boutique ambiance" and facilities including a two-passenger submarine, four 10-passenger zodiacs and a 12-passenger Wider 32-ft super yacht tender. 
Passengers will also be able to use the ship's water skis, wake boards, kayaks and jet skis, plus fishing, scuba and snorkel equipment. 
Crystal Esprit will mark the debut of the new all-inclusive Crystal Yacht Cruises programme, sailing seven-day warm-water itineraries. 
From 2016 to early 2018, it will sail around the Seychelles, from Dubai around United Arab Emirates states, and along the Adriatic Coast from Dubrovnik to Athens. TAJ HOTELS The Crystal Esprit will spend New Year's Eve at the Taj Dubai Hotel 
Meanwhile, from 2017 Crystal River Cruises will offer Crystal Cruises' famous "six-star service" with designer suites, superb food and included excursions. 
Also in 2017, Crystal Luxury Air will offer "extravagant around-the-world trips" in the world's most advanced twin-aisle Boeing 787 Dreamliner. The plush aircraft, which usually seats 300, will take just 60 guests in fully reclining business class seats to destinations to which major airlines do not offer a non-stop service. 
And finally, the first Crystal Exclusive Class ships will arrive in late 2018 - expedition ships with all the amenities of a luxury ship or private yacht. 
The all-suite, all-balcony ships will take 1,000 passengers, and Rodriguez said: "Our new ships' guest-to-space ratios will be vast in comparison to past, current and under-construction luxury ships, reaching all corners of the world safely, smoothly and in the utmost style and comfort." GETTY The Crystal Esprit will venture out to Athens between 2016 to 2018 
On the top deck of the new ships will be 48 "homes", with their own private restaurant, reception and facilities. 
These will have much higher ceilings (9ft) than other cruise ship cabins. 
Standard suites will be a minimum 400 square feet, nearly double the size of other luxury vessels, with 8ft ceilings instead of the usual 7ft. 
There will also be 1,000 crew members to provide an "unheard of" one-to-one crew-to-guest ratio. 
And menus will be created by Michelin-starred and celebrity chefs. 
For more information call 020 7399 7601 or visit www.crystalcruises.co.uk
